private_information: I observe the first scenario with objects indexed 0 through 11 and the first initial statement and plan.
I know the initial facts from the first statement and the sequence of actions in the first plan.
playerA.goal: Provide a concise structured summary of the initial facts, the goal, and the plan steps for the first scenario. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: I observe the second scenario with objects indexed 0 through 12 and the second initial statement and the (empty) plan placeholder.
I know the initial facts and goal described in the second statement.
playerB.goal: Provide a concise structured summary of the initial facts and the goal for the second scenario. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: I coordinate the inputs from playerA and playerB and must synthesize a single correct PDDL domain and PDDL problems for FastDownwards.
I must keep agent actions distinct when relevant and resolve object name mappings and precondition/effect consistency.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem files suitable to be solved by the FastDownwards planner that represent the action schemata, initial states, and goals integrated from the two scenario summaries.

public_information: There is a set of actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Actions take object arguments. Each action has explicit preconditions and effects relating to predicates such as hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, spring, collect.
Example constraints: paltry requires hand X cats Y texture Z vase X Y and next Y Z. Paltry makes next X Z true and removes vase X Y.
sip requires hand X cats Y texture Z next X Z and next Y Z. Sip makes vase X Y true and removes next X Z.
clip requires hand X sneeze Y texture Z next Y Z and next X Z. Clip makes vase X Y true and removes next X Z.
wretched requires sneeze X texture Y texture Z stupendous W next X Y collect Y W and collect Z W. Wretched makes next X Z true and removes next X Y.
memory requires cats X spring Y spring Z and next X Y. Memory makes next X Z true and removes next X Y.
tightfisted requires hand X sneeze Y texture Z next Y Z and vase X Y. Tightfisted makes next X Z true and removes vase X Y.
The planning tasks ask to achieve specific next relations between particular indexed objects starting from the provided initial facts.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst agent. Extract and return a concise structured summary of the first scenario. The summary must include three sections: initial_facts, goal, plan_steps. Do not produce PDDL. Keep object identifiers as given.
analyze.prompt: You are playerA. Use the public information and your private information to extract initial_facts, the declared goal, and the ordered plan steps for the first scenario. If any information is missing, list the uncertainty explicitly. Return only the structured summary. Do not generate PDDL or attempt to solve the planning problem.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst agent. Extract and return a concise structured summary of the second scenario. The summary must include two sections: initial_facts and goal. Do not produce PDDL. Keep object identifiers as given.
analyze.prompt: You are playerB. Use the public information and your private information to extract initial_facts and the declared goal for the second scenario. If any information is missing, list the uncertainty explicitly. Return only the structured summary. Do not generate PDDL or attempt to solve the planning problem.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for producing a clean PDDL domain and problem files suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the two scenario summaries into consistent PDDL. Keep action schemas faithful to the public action descriptions and preserve object identifiers. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Target FastDownwards by including appropriate :requirements and typing where needed. Keep agent actions distinct only if their semantics differ. Resolve naming inconsistencies conservatively and document any mapping decisions in a short comment at the top of the domain or problem.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive two structured summaries from playerA and playerB. Integrate them into a single PDDL domain that defines the predicates and all action schemata paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted with the preconditions and effects as described in the public information. Then produce two PDDL problem files or a single problem file that represents the active scenario to be solved by FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. If you must choose which scenario to generate a problem for, produce problems for both scenarios and label them clearly. Include a short comment describing any object renamings or ambiguities resolved. Output must be valid PDDL for FastDownwards.
